intro: Knautia sixtina, commonly known as the Sixtina knautia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flower heads that consist of numerous small, tubular florets. Knautia sixtina typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
